title: Support connections to vino VNC server
author: adrianabadin
body_snippet:
<!-- Cuando intento conectar desde mremoteng en windows 7 64 bits me marca el siguiente error
¡Fallo abriendo conexiones!
Unable to read next byte(s)
desde otro servidor con ubuntu desde remmina otro software puedo conectar sin probemas-->
|||
|--:|---|
|Operating system | Windows 7 x64 |
|mRemoteNG version| 1.75 aplha 3  |

comments.author: adrianabadin
comments.snippet:
al intentar conectarme con un servidor con VINO en ubuntu 14.04 desde un pc con windows 7 64 bits me emite el siguiente error.
¡Fallo abriendo conexiones!
Unable to read next byte(s).
hay alguna solucion?

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
(Traducido a través de Google)

¿Podría proporcionar el archivo mRemoteNG.log? Eso nos puede ayudar a averiguar qué pasó.

Detalles sobre el archivo de registro aquí: https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/wiki/Troubleshooting-and-Logging

comments.author: kmscode
comments.snippet:
For clarification, it appears that "vino" is the VNC server running on Ubuntu:
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/VNC/Servers

Problem reproduced. Nothing special in the log:
```
2017-03-17 13:51:06,808 [1] ERROR- Opening connection failed!
Unable to read next byte(s).
2017-03-17 13:51:06,815 [9] INFO - Connection Event Closed
2017-03-17 13:51:06,816 [9] INFO - Connection to {host} via VNC closed by user {currently logged in user}".
```

vino log:
```
7/03/2017 01:50:51 PM Autoprobin...

comments.author: e-alfred
comments.snippet:
Did you try to disable TLS in Vino? The error here indicates it:

```
17/03/2017 01:51:06 PM Advertising security type 18
17/03/2017 01:51:06 PM Client returned security type 0
```

This helped me here with a Windows Client connecting to a Gnome based Desktop as a workaround. And here is more info on it:

http://askubuntu.com/questions/408365/gnome-3-10-sharing-desktop-how-to-configure-the-security-type-for-vnc#408375

comments.author: kmscode
comments.snippet:
@e-alfred Thanks!

Confirmed, disabling TLS in vino allowed mRemoteNG/VncSharp to connect.
